reviews.text: Everything about this hostel is top-notch. The environment and style of the building, the staff and the roof-terrace with tabletennis. Breakfast nothing much, although the coffee is good.
reviews.title: Best staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almagro, the area where the hostel is situated, is very local and has a good vibe with nice cheap bars and parilla restaurants. The hostel although can't be described. The staff are great, and there is something about the architecture and decor that generates a nice social atmosphere without being "enforced sociability".
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Me and my husband booked for two different periods.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: The first one, which was on a shared room they messed up, put us in completely different rooms, although the reservation was for two people together. They couldn't fix, but one of the owners (Antoine) was so helpful and concerned that we ended up being ok with that.
reviews.title: fantastic place for the money

reviews.text: The second one was perfect, rooms were cozy, the size, facilities and breakfast were ok, nothing remarkable, but just what we needed for a comfy stay.
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful

reviews.text: I loved the ChillHouse, the owners and employees were all very friendly and answered our endless questions about the area/nightlife/travel etc. I would definitely recommend this place its in a great spot to catch a bus/subway or just to walk around town during the day.
reviews.title: Great owners, cool spot...loved it!

reviews.text: We had a room near the common room which we thought was going to be a problem but it was really quiet and relaxed, my only disappointment is that it was rainy when we were there so we didn't get to take advantage of that terrace!
reviews.title: One of the best places we visited during our travel through Argentina

reviews.text: This is a beautiful colonial style hostel with kind and helpful personel, and a very kind owner! We stayed in a double room, which was spacious and tidy. The bathroom was comfortable and during breakfast you can make your own orange juice. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: A Perfect place

reviews.text: The hostel is just great. I love high quality and this is exetctly what I got with a cool french tuch. The staff is very helpfull and the place is very clean. 24/7 you got someone that allway glad to help. I travaled all over Argentina and this one is a nomber one.
reviews.title: Decent, but a bit out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners of ChillHouse couldn't be nicer; they were so helpful before and during our stay. That said, it is in quite a random location pretty far from most of the sites in Burnos Aires, although only about 5 - 6 blocks from the Metro which made it easy to get around. There's a big supermarket right near the train, which is convenient if you want to pick up any groceries. The room we stayed in was right off the entrance, and a lot of sounds and smells (esp cigarette smoke) coming in at night.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in BsAs

reviews.text: This hostel was SO excellent I don't even know where to start. The hostel itself is a really cool building with a relaxed dining room and even more relaxed rooftop lounge area. It is a really comfortable place to be in, which has a lot to do with the staff. The team there is an amazing group to be around, as far as helping with questions, or just hanging out. I was lucky enough to go their NYE party. I highly recommend this hostel, it is by far the best I've ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Great hostel in Bs As

reviews.text: Stayed at ChillHouse in December and was a fantastic stay. Everything from the rooms, the roof terrace and the staff were brilliant. Antoine especially was a lovely host, helping with arrangements, advice on what to do and general welcoming us to BA. Close to a huge useful supermarket, lots of restaurants and the subway. 20 minute walk to the fantastic bars and night life of Palermo Viejo which was a bonus, Definitely consider the place if you want a reasonably priced, but fun place to say in BA. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
reviews.title: Splendid hostel in BA

reviews.text: The best part about this hostel were the owners - Antoine in particular. He takes a lot of care to show you around the hostel and to be warm and friendly and helpful. We were here on Christmas Eve and Antoine hosted an amazing asado and dance on the rooftop terrace - one of my fondest memories in Argentina. The atmosphere in the hostel is also very nice and everything is nice and clean. If you are booking a private room request one on the second floor which are quieter and have windows. Thanks Antoine and to the rest of your staff for such a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Amazing owners

reviews.text: The Chillhouse was one of the best, if not the best place I have been to during the last two months (I really went to a lot of hostels...)! Not only, that the team was friendly and the rooms really beautifull- I also recieved a lot of help from all the people working there. I especially have to mention Antoine, one of the owners of the Hostel. During a big thunderstorm which fludded all Buenos Aires he helped me find a Taxi which nearly took 1 hour of time! Thanks for that- I got my bus ;)!
reviews.title: Julian Zoller

reviews.text: Looking forward to go back if in BS AS again!
reviews.title: Great, friendly place!

reviews.text: I'll state the few negatives first: the reservation process was a bit confused with some rooms offered when they were really not available (though, admittedly, I reserved via email alone and the friendly owners did offer me the couch for free for two nights). Also, the breakfast could be a bit better than rolls, jam, coffee and tea. Perhaps some dulce de leche, fruit, yogurt and granola? Lastly, the WIFI seemed to be a bit temperamental.
reviews.title: Really, really nice stay, with some problems...

reviews.text: Those negatives aside, this is a really, really nice place to stay in Buenos Aires. The location is nice -- two blocks from metro, one block from an atmospheric shopping mall and a giant discount grocery store, 20-30 pleasant minutes from Recoleta or Palermo by foot.
reviews.title: Mixed bag, depends what you're looking for in BA!?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying here is really more like staying in a home or a B&B than a hostel, hence the Trip Advisor category. The friendly staff and well-decorated living room and roof terrace provide a host of places to hang out and enjoy the staff's hospitality.
reviews.title: Well deserved reputation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Showers are hot with great pressure. Beds are comfortable with good linens and duvets.
reviews.title: Great hostel

reviews.text: With a few tweaks, this would be a definite five-star accommodation -- and, even without them, it is an outstanding place to base yourself in Buenos Aires. Easy to meet friendly people here, too.
reviews.title: Deserves all the praise.
